reasoning: Autosomal dominant hypoparathyroidism (ADH) is a rare endocrine disorder characterized by hypoparathyroidism with developmental abnormalities (GATA3 mutations). Incidence estimated ~0.5 per 100k person-years; prevalence ~3 per 100k. Mixed inheritance pattern; autosomal dominant form is minority of cases. Limited epidemiological data; confidence based on small clinical cohorts.
source: Thakker RV. (2011). Hypoparathyroidism. N Engl J Med. 364(10):934-947
